request.noAuth: This request does not use any authorization.
request.inheritDescription: Authorization is inherited from the parent folder or collection.
request.noBody: This request does not have a body.

response.noResponse: Hit Send to get a response
response.largeJson: Large JSON detected. Render tree on demand to avoid lag.
response.binaryResponse: Binary response — this content cannot be displayed as text.
response.noSentRequest: No request has been sent yet.

collection.name: Collection Name
collection.variablesHint: Variables available to all requests in this collection. Environment variables override these.
collection.duplicateNameError: Name must be different from the original

collectionDetail.noDescription: No description. Click to add one.
collectionDetail.authDescription: Set authorization that applies to all requests in this collection. Individual request auth settings will override these.
collectionDetail.preRequestDescription: This script runs before every request in this collection. Use req.request.headers, req.variables, req.sendRequest() etc. Request-level scripts run after this.
collectionDetail.testsDescription: This script runs after every response in this collection. Use req.response, req.test(), req.expect() etc. Request-level scripts run after this.

folder.name: Folder Name
folder.noDescription: No description. Click to add one.

dashboard.subtitle: What would you like to do?
dashboard.importDataDesc: Import from Postman format, OpenAPI, or cURL
dashboard.aiGenerateDesc: Generate collection from docs or URL
dashboard.noCollections: No collections yet. Create your first one!

environment.globalsDescription: Workspace-level variables available in all requests. Lowest priority — overridden by collection and environment variables.

workspace.name: Workspace Name
workspace.selectWorkspaceDescription: Choose a workspace to join. You will be added as a viewer.
workspace.noWorkspacesAvailable: No workspaces available. Contact an administrator.

ai.wizardDescription: Paste your API documentation or provide a URL, and AI will generate a complete request collection with all endpoints, methods, headers, and example bodies.
ai.collectionNamesHint: Leave empty to let AI name it. Use commas or new lines for multiple.
ai.customInstructionsPlaceholder: e.g. Create multiple collections by domain; do not create folders; group auth endpoints together.
ai.customInstructionsHint: Applied to both documentation and URL modes.
ai.documentationPlaceholder:
Paste your API documentation here...

Example:
GET /api/users - List all users
POST /api/users - Create a user
  Body: { "name": "John", "email": "john@example.com" }
GET /api/users/:id - Get user by ID
...
ai.urlDescription: AI will search and crawl this URL and its sub-pages to discover all API endpoints. This may take a few minutes for large documentation sites.
ai.generatingDescription: AI is analyzing your documentation and creating requests. This may take a few seconds.
ai.generatingFromUrlDescription: AI is researching the website and extracting API endpoints. This may take a few minutes.
ai.urlDisabledOllama: URL research is not available with Ollama. Paste documentation instead.

settings.aiProviderDescription: Choose between OpenAI (cloud) or Ollama (local) for AI-powered collection generation.
settings.aiDescription: Connect your OpenAI API key to enable AI-powered collection generation from API documentation.
settings.ollamaNoModels: No models found. Is Ollama running?
settings.openaiNoModels: No models found. Check your API key.
settings.openaiModelWarning: Not all models support all features (web search, function calling). Recommended: gpt-4.1-mini, gpt-4.1, gpt-4o — these fully support tool use. Models like o1, o3 may have limited tool support.
settings.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters
settings.deleteUserConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete user {{name}}? This action cannot be undone.

import.title: Import Collection
import.postmanDescription: Import a collection JSON file. Supports Postman Collection v2.1; requests, folders, headers, bodies, and auth settings are preserved.
import.openApiDescription: Import an OpenAPI 3.x or Swagger 2.0 specification. Endpoints will be organized by tags with auto-generated example bodies.
import.curlDescription: Paste a cURL command to import it as a new request. Method, URL, headers, body, and authentication will be extracted automatically.

importExport.title: Import / Export
importExport.exportSubtitle: Export your data in different formats
importExport.postmanDesc: Import collections from Postman format with environments
importExport.curlDesc: Paste any cURL command to create request
importExport.exportJsonDesc: Full backup with scripts and variables

scripts.aiGenerateDescription: Describe what you want your script to do. AI will generate the script based on available commands — your request data is never sent.
scripts.aiPlaceholder: e.g. Check that the response status is 200 and the body contains a 'data' array with at least one item...
scripts.suggestUuid: Generate random UUID for request ID
scripts.suggestFullValidation: Full response validation with all checks
scripts.docsIntro: Scripts use a Python-based DSL. Each line is a standalone command — no multiline blocks, loops or conditionals.
scripts.docsIntroJs: Scripts use a JavaScript-like DSL (req-compatible). Each line is a standalone command — no multiline blocks, loops or conditionals.
scripts.docsConsoleLogDesc: Log a message to the console output.
scripts.docsTestDesc: Create a named test assertion. The expression must evaluate to True or False.
scripts.docsLogDesc: Log a message to the console output.
scripts.docsVarSetDesc: Set a request-scoped variable accessible in URL, headers and body via {{key}}.
scripts.docsGlobalSetDesc: Set a global variable that persists across all requests.
scripts.docsAssertDesc: Simple assertion — script fails if expression is False.
scripts.docsAssignDesc: Assign a value to a local variable for later use in the script.
scripts.docsJsonDesc: Parsed JSON response. Access nested fields with dot notation.
scripts.docsHeadersDesc: Response headers dictionary. Access by header name.

websocket.title: WebSocket
websocket.messageInput: Type a message... (Enter to send, Shift+Enter for new line)
websocket.noMessages: No messages yet. Connect to a WebSocket server to start.

graphql.explorerNoSchema: No schema loaded. Fetch the schema first.
graphql.insertQueryTooltip: Insert this operation into the editor

pathParam.hint: Press Enter to apply, Escape to cancel

sdk.title: SDK Generator
sdk.description: Generate client SDKs for your API collections. Supports C# and Python with full authentication and environment support.

postmanImport.collectionFileDesc: Drag & drop or click to select your .postman_collection.json file
postmanImport.collectionFileHint: Required — supports Postman Collection v2.1 format
postmanImport.environmentFilesHint: Optional — You can add multiple .postman_environment.json files
postmanImport.collectionCreated: Collection "{{name}}" created with {{requests}} requests in {{folders}} folders

setup.welcomeDescription: Let's set up your API testing workspace. This wizard will guide you through the initial configuration.
setup.themeDescription: You can always change this later in Settings.
setup.createAdminDescription: Set up the first administrator account for your OpenReq instance.
setup.aiConfigDescription: Configure an AI provider for automatic collection generation from API documentation.
setup.apiKeyDescription: Optionally configure an OpenAI API key to enable AI-powered features like automatic collection generation from API documentation.
setup.apiKeyOptional: This step is optional. You can configure AI settings later in Settings.
setup.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters
setup.usernameTooShort: Username must be at least 3 characters
setup.completeDescription: Your OpenReq instance is ready. Redirecting to the application...
setup.createWorkspaceDescription: Create your first workspace. Workspaces help organize your API collections and environments.
setup.createEnvironmentDescription: Create at least one environment for your workspace. Environments store variables like API URLs and keys.
setup.environmentRequired: At least one environment with a name is required

runner.title: Collection Runner
runner.iterationsHint: Number of times to run the collection (1–100)
runner.unsavedBodySingle: This tab has unsaved changes. Save before closing?
runner.unsavedBodyMulti: {{count}} tabs have unsaved changes. Close them anyway?
runner.noRuns: No run reports yet. Run this collection to see reports here.
runner.deleteRunConfirm: Delete this run report? This action cannot be undone.

requestSettings.verifySslDesc: Verify SSL certificates when sending the request
requestSettings.followOriginalMethodDesc: Use original HTTP method instead of switching to GET on redirect
requestSettings.followAuthHeaderDesc: Keep the Authorization header when following redirects
requestSettings.removeRefererDesc: Strip the Referer header when following redirects to a different host
requestSettings.encodeUrlDesc: Automatically percent-encode special characters in the URL
requestSettings.disableCookieJarDesc: Do not store or send cookies between requests
requestSettings.serverCipherSuiteDesc: Prefer the server's cipher suite order during TLS handshake
requestSettings.maxRedirectsDesc: Maximum number of HTTP redirects to follow (0–100)
requestSettings.disabledTlsProtocolsDesc: Select TLS protocol versions to disable. Click to toggle.

aiAgent.title: George AI
aiAgent.noProvider: No AI provider configured. Set up OpenAI or Ollama in Settings.
aiAgent.welcomeMessage: Hi! I'm George, your API testing assistant. I can help you write test scripts, explain API responses, and more. How can I help?

common.name: Name
common.deleteConfirm: Delete {{name}}? This action cannot be undone.
common.unsavedBodySingle: This tab has unsaved changes. Save before closing?
common.unsavedBodyMulti: {{count}} tabs have unsaved changes. Close them anyway?

testFlow.title: Test Builder
testFlow.createFirst: Create your first test flow to get started.
testFlow.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this test flow?
testFlow.confirmDeleteRun: Are you sure you want to delete this run report?

nodeDescriptions.collection: Run all requests in a collection
nodeDescriptions.websocket: Connect and send a WebSocket message

nodeConfig.conditionHelpVars: Available: status_code, response_body, response_headers, elapsed_ms, vars, iteration

nodeHelp.httpRequest: Executes a saved HTTP request. Connect to an Assertion node to validate the response, or to a Condition node for custom flow control.
nodeHelp.collection: Runs all requests in a collection sequentially. Variables are accumulated across requests.
nodeHelp.assertion: Checks the HTTP response against predefined rules (status code, body content, headers, response time). All checks must pass for the True branch; any failure triggers the False branch.
nodeHelp.condition: Evaluates a custom Python expression using variables and response data (status_code, response_body, elapsed_ms, etc.). True result → left branch, False result → right branch.
nodeHelp.loop: Repeats all connected 'Loop Body' nodes. Count mode: fixed number of iterations. Condition mode: repeats while the expression is true (with access to response data).
nodeHelp.script: Runs JavaScript or Python code for custom data transformation, variable manipulation, or complex assertions.
nodeHelp.delay: Pauses execution for the specified number of milliseconds before continuing to the next node.
nodeHelp.setVariable: Sets flow variables that downstream nodes can access via {{variable_name}} syntax.
nodeHelp.websocket: Connects to a WebSocket server, sends a message, and optionally waits for a response. Supports variable substitution in URL and message.
nodeHelp.graphql: Sends a GraphQL query to an endpoint via HTTP POST. Variables are sent as JSON alongside the query. Reuses HTTP proxy for execution.

docGenerator.title: Documentation Generator
docGenerator.useAIDesc: Add AI-generated descriptions for endpoints and parameters
docGenerator.extraPromptHint: e.g. 'Focus on authentication flow', 'Add getting started section'
docGenerator.noRequests: No requests found in this collection/folder

testFlowWizard.title: AI Test Flow Generator
testFlowWizard.subtitle: Generate a complete test flow from your collection
testFlowWizard.extraPromptHint: e.g., Focus on error handling, test edge cases...

proxyMode.label: Proxy Mode
proxyMode.serverDesc: Requests are sent through the OpenReq server
proxyMode.localDesc: Requests are sent directly from your machine
proxyMode.localNotAvailable: Install Chrome extension or use the desktop app
proxyMode.collectionRunnerWarning: Collection runs always execute through the server.

share.title: Share Docs
share.passwordRequired: This documentation is password-protected. Please enter the password to continue.
share.disabled: This share link has been disabled

openapi.description: Write your OpenAPI or AsyncAPI specification in YAML or JSON. Save to persist changes, then use Preview to view as interactive documentation (SwaggerUI for OpenAPI, AsyncAPI viewer for AsyncAPI).
